channel.title: Papers with Code: Trending (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Less-to-More Generalization: Unlocking More Controllability by In-Context Generation
item.description: In this study, we propose a highly-consistent data synthesis pipeline to tackle this challenge.

item.title: DDT: Decoupled Diffusion Transformer
item.description: For ImageNet $256\times256$, Our DDT-XL/2 achieves a new state-of-the-art performance of {1. 31 FID}~(nearly $4\times$ faster training convergence compared to previous diffusion transformers).

item.title: Advances and Challenges in Foundation Agents: From Brain-Inspired Intelligence to Evolutionary, Collaborative, and Safe Systems
item.description: The advent of large language models (LLMs) has catalyzed a transformative shift in artificial intelligence, paving the way for advanced intelligent agents capable of sophisticated reasoning, robust perception, and versatile action across diverse domains.

item.title: IndexTTS: An Industrial-Level Controllable and Efficient Zero-Shot Text-To-Speech System
item.description: Recently, large language model (LLM) based text-to-speech (TTS) systems have gradually become the mainstream in the industry due to their high naturalness and powerful zero-shot voice cloning capabilities. Here, we introduce the IndexTTS system, which is mainly based on the XTTS and Tortoise model.

item.title: Zep: A Temporal Knowledge Graph Architecture for Agent Memory
item.description: We introduce Zep, a novel memory layer service for AI agents that outperforms the current state-of-the-art system, MemGPT, in the Deep Memory Retrieval (DMR) benchmark.

item.title: VGGT: Visual Geometry Grounded Transformer
item.description: We present VGGT, a feed-forward neural network that directly infers all key 3D attributes of a scene, including camera parameters, point maps, depth maps, and 3D point tracks, from one, a few, or hundreds of its views.

item.title: Spark-TTS: An Efficient LLM-Based Text-to-Speech Model with Single-Stream Decoupled Speech Tokens
item.description: Recent advancements in large language models (LLMs) have driven significant progress in zero-shot text-to-speech (TTS) synthesis.

item.title: Audio-visual Controlled Video Diffusion with Masked Selective State Spaces Modeling for Natural Talking Head Generation
item.description: To this end, we introduce \textbf{ACTalker}, an end-to-end video diffusion framework that supports both multi-signals control and single-signal control for talking head video generation.

item.title: Agent S2: A Compositional Generalist-Specialist Framework for Computer Use Agents
item.description: Computer use agents automate digital tasks by directly interacting with graphical user interfaces (GUIs) on computers and mobile devices, offering significant potential to enhance human productivity by completing an open-ended space of user queries.

item.title: GPT-ImgEval: A Comprehensive Benchmark for Diagnosing GPT4o in Image Generation
item.description: The recent breakthroughs in OpenAI's GPT4o model have demonstrated surprisingly good capabilities in image generation and editing, resulting in significant excitement in the community.

item.title: Olympus: A Universal Task Router for Computer Vision Tasks
item.description: We introduce Olympus, a new approach that transforms Multimodal Large Language Models (MLLMs) into a unified framework capable of handling a wide array of computer vision tasks.

item.title: LightRAG: Simple and Fast Retrieval-Augmented Generation
item.description: Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) systems enhance large language models (LLMs) by integrating external knowledge sources, enabling more accurate and contextually relevant responses tailored to user needs.

item.title: SVDQuant: Absorbing Outliers by Low-Rank Components for 4-Bit Diffusion Models
item.description: To address this, we co-design an inference engine Nunchaku that fuses the kernels of the low-rank branch into those of the low-bit branch to cut off redundant memory access.

item.title: Rethinking RL Scaling for Vision Language Models: A Transparent, From-Scratch Framework and Comprehensive Evaluation Scheme
item.description: Reinforcement learning (RL) has recently shown strong potential in improving the reasoning capabilities of large language models and is now being actively extended to vision-language models (VLMs).

item.title: CFG-Zero*: Improved Classifier-Free Guidance for Flow Matching Models
item.description: Classifier-Free Guidance (CFG) is a widely adopted technique in diffusion/flow models to improve image fidelity and controllability.

item.title: SkyReels-A2: Compose Anything in Video Diffusion Transformers
item.description: This paper presents SkyReels-A2, a controllable video generation framework capable of assembling arbitrary visual elements (e. g., characters, objects, backgrounds) into synthesized videos based on textual prompts while maintaining strict consistency with reference images for each element.

item.title: LHM: Large Animatable Human Reconstruction Model from a Single Image in Seconds
item.description: Animatable 3D human reconstruction from a single image is a challenging problem due to the ambiguity in decoupling geometry, appearance, and deformation.

item.title: InfiniteYou: Flexible Photo Recrafting While Preserving Your Identity
item.description: Achieving flexible and high-fidelity identity-preserved image generation remains formidable, particularly with advanced Diffusion Transformers (DiTs) like FLUX.

item.title: Multi-SWE-bench: A Multilingual Benchmark for Issue Resolving
item.description: The task of issue resolving is to modify a codebase to generate a patch that addresses a given issue.

item.title: Open Deep Search: Democratizing Search with Open-source Reasoning Agents
item.description: Open Search Tool is a novel web search tool that outperforms proprietary counterparts.
